intro: Babbagia scleroptera, commonly known as the hard-leaved babbagia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features dense, silver-gray foliage with tightly packed, narrow leaves that are covered in a fine layer of hair. Its flowering period typically occurs in late summer, producing small, yellowish flowers that attract pollinators. Babbagia scleroptera is adapted to arid and rocky environments, demonstrating resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
